needed_frontend_statement.text: All nontrivial zeros rho=beta+i gamma with 0<gamma<=H0 satisfy beta=1/2.

reference.authors: D. J. Platt and T. S. Trudgian
reference.title: The Riemann hypothesis is true up to 3*10^12
reference.venue: Bulletin of the London Mathematical Society
reference.statement: All zeros beta+i gamma with 0<gamma<=3*10^12 satisfy beta=1/2 (rigorous interval arithmetic).

discharged_by.logic: If RH holds for 0<gamma<=H_cited and H0<=H_cited, then RH holds for 0<gamma<=H0.

notes: This JSON is not itself a computation of zeros; it is a pinned statement+reference used by v31.

For a fully self-contained proof without external computational input, one would need to implement and certify an argument-principle zero count in this region using ball arithmetic (not provided here).
